series.title: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
series.author: Jen Kirkman

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF Announcement
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: jenkirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: I’M NOT TRYING TO START A CULT
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about how she doesn’t want to hear from celebrity moms who eat in the shower, why guys need to stop emailing her explaining their Twitter missteps, listener emails are read that cover everything from how make-up works on TV, to how success doesn’t make problems go away and a bunch of listeners weigh in on a listener they hate. This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ROOM(MATES) TO GROW
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
Jen sits at home to talk to you about why we all hate talking on the phone, gives advice about how to be honest with messy roommates and tells a cautionary tale about being a doormat who had nightmares, and talks about the time she got chased by a bee and fell on her face and talks about if you’re the sensitive one in your group of friends.  This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com

 

(RELEASE DATE 2/21/2017)

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: MAILING IT IN
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
(RELEASE DATE 2/14/2017)
Jen sits at home to talk to you about some things that are on listener’s minds, like a millennial who hates millennial, a girl who thinks Jen is a hypocrite and shouldn’t talk politics, some questions and advice from an airplane mechanic, how podcasts help heal sadness, and someone who wants to bring a date to her brother’s wedding. This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: MAKING RE-ARRANGEMENTS
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
(RELEASE DATE 2/7/2017)
Jen sits at home to talk to you about why she’s rearranging things in her house while she podcasts, a dude making an annoying joke at Starbucks while she had headphones in, the mystery of Tim from San Francisco who wants to find love continues, getting a new car that isn’t ostentatious or good for the environment, and the debunked news story about a super pill for the brain.  This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THIS WEEK SEEMED FUN: announcement
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jenkirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: LIVE FROM SAN FRANCISCO
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen takes to the stage at the Swedish American Hall in San Francisco during the SF Sketchfest to talk to the audience about strange mystical healing sessions, people who say “the bay area”, a love-connection in the audience gone wrong, how we should give up hope for America in a spiritual sense, and an article about how therapists are overwhelmed with patients since the election. This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: HO’S BEFORE BROS
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk about the surprise of her week - Dice, cheering her up. Brocialists on Twitter who are too concerned with if Jen marched on not. Jen’s experience at a women’s march with bossy women, and then getting Bernie Bro’d by a waiter, and then realizing that it’s not good to drink a pot of coffee before a turbulent flight. This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THEY SEEM FUN WITH TAMI FITZKOFF
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
Jen takes to the All Things Comedy studios to talk with her friend, old comedy stomping ground pal, and now children’s author Tami Fitzkoff about her journey from the east to the west coast, coming out, going back in, coming out and finding love, changing her mind about kids, health issues that used to cause shame, traveling to Paris and not falling in love, putting away a life in comedy by listening to an inner voice, and living a life for yourself, not for your family’s expectations. Oh, and of course there’s talk of NYC on 9/11 in this episode! First of the year!
Her children’s book about embracing being different “Be The Grapes” is available on Amazon.com.  This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THIS WEEK SEEMED FUN Episode 8: “AGE OF AQUARIUS“ (RELEASED 1/13/2017)
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This podcast is a weekly, Friday night bonus installment of “I Seem Fun” where Jen takes a half hour to talk about what happened in pop culture and politics this week that SHE cares about. This week Jen talks about is 2017 the Age of Aquarius? She also talks about the 100 year anniversary of Girl Scout Cookies, and the horrible incident on New Year’s Eve in a progressive town in India.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: UGH, WHO WANTS TO TALK?
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk about how sick she is of talking about herself.  Jen talks about her new tour, where to see her in Los Angeles soon, being so done with the holidays, plays proof of her I Seem Fun episode prediction in 2015 of Putin stealing the election, and reads listener emails about people fearing 40 being too old to start a new life, a gay I Seem Funner wanting to meet a boyfriend at her show, and women who want to swing their dicks in 2017.  This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THIS WEEK SEEMED FUN Episode 7: “ACCIDENTAL LIKES AND WASTING MONEY“ (RELEASED 1/6/2017)
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This podcast is a weekly, Friday night bonus installment of “I Seem Fun” where Jen takes a half hour to talk about what happened in pop culture and politics this week that SHE cares about. This week Jen talks about what NYC could do with the $125 million it’s going to take to protect Trump, how Mrs. Knowles left social media after a controversial “like”, and how the French don’t have to return their work emails on weekends.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: NOT REALL ANY EPISODE!
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
I Seem Fun January 3rd, 2017 announcement.

 

JenKirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: EPISODE 163: THEY SEEM FUN WITH JON CRYER
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen takes to the All Things Comedy Studio with her special interview guest Jon Cryer. They talk about his fantastic memoir, “So That Happened”, believing in Santa, the concept of masculinity, being “of the theatre”, residual checks, an alternate feminist ending to Pretty in Pink, when expectations are different than outcomes, being loud, dealing with Twitter, what’s next and not next for Jon’s ever expanding, ass-kicking career.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: EPISODE 163: MINI
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at the All Things Comedy Studio waiting for her special guest - and she tells the story of a Santa who called a nine-year-old boy “fat” and the repercussions that followed.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: YOU’RE WRITING TO A HUMAN
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk about the country being “corrupt af” and how she is wondering if she’s not smart or if the president is like, “I’m done with you people.” She warns listeners about emailing her, she’s a human and no she won’t unblock anyone. Jen also worries that the holiday season is passing her by, reads customer service emails, and talks about Madonna’s recent bad-ass speech. This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: A PRESS JUNKET WITH THE KIRKMAN’S
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen interviews her parents and sister about what it was like acting in her new Netflix special “Just Keep Living’?” that premieres worldwide on Netflix, January 3rd, 2017.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THE STREETS OF NYC
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen does her first ever podcast while walking the streets of New York City. And the audio is great! She talks about the mysterious military plane that was flying around all day freaking everyone out for no reason. She also discusses holiday lights and the plot of another Hallmark movie - this time it’s about a busy business woman who wishes she was never married.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF From Plane
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: jenkirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: WHAT’S A PHOENIX?
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home recovering from Norovirus to tell you how not to get Norovirus, why she feels empowered to swing her dick this year, thanks to all who came to the dysfunctional Christmas show, the plot of a Hallmark Movie starring Candace - and a special reading of an essay for gay men and the women in their life.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THIS WEEK SEEMED FUN Episode 6: “TAXES, NARCISSISTS AND RAGE ROOMS"
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This podcast is a weekly, Friday night bonus installment of “I Seem Fun” where Jen takes a half hour to talk about what happened in pop culture and politics this week that SHE cares about. This week Jen talks about how Trump didn’t really save jobs in Indiana without burdening the worker, Rage Rooms are popping up all over the world, The Mall of America has it’s first Black Santa, and some thoughts on the broken promise of the dot-com boom that the office as we know it will be dead.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THERE IS NO NEED TO GREET ME!
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk about how she wants to be left alone at CVS, seeing a reindeer in Los Angeles, why people sound stupid who think L.A doesn’t get cold, what you guys think about driverless cars, and Bostonians putting me in headlocks. This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com. Use offer code JEN for a discount.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THIS WEEK SEEMED FUN Episode 5: “APOCOLYPSE NOW?”
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
(RELEASED 11/25/2016)
This podcast is a weekly, Friday night bonus installment of “I Seem Fun” where Jen takes a half hour to talk about what happened in pop culture and politics this week that SHE cares about. This week Jen talks about how we found evidence of maybe past lives on Mars, our alien signal catching program isn’t quite set up correctly and we could miss the call, The North Pole could be out of ice soon, and Lindsay is "helping refugees" with an expensive nightclub in Greece.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF Thanksgiving Announcement
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: jenkirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: The Thanksgiving Episode
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen takes to the All Things Comedy Studio to tell you that the first Thanksgiving wasn't a day and it involved "pilgrims" being nervous and shooting off their guns (true story), she reminisces about doughnuts, walking and talking with her nana, why she's grateful to not be anxious in a relationship like last year, and realizes while she's talking that she had a really good ending for a joke in her next special and it's too late.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THIS WEEK SEEMED FUN Episode 4: “DONNY IS A COASTAL ELITE”
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This podcast is a weekly, Friday night bonus installment of “I Seem Fun” where Jen takes a half hour to talk about what happened in pop culture and politics this week that SHE cares about. This week Jen talks about her frustration at the notion that city-folk are “elite”, exposes Rudy’s 9/11 fail, there’s an anti-semite in Trump’s gang, and explains exactly how to effectively contact your representatives, and lists some charities to donate time or money to.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: FEAR OF FLYING
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home for an extra-long, very special episode of “I Seem Fun” that is solely dedicated to the phobia of air travel.  So many listeners have wanted to know how Jen conquered her fear of flying and all of the stories, tips, notions, facts, and more are covered in this episode from cognitive behavioral changes, to safety facts, fun self-care tips, the truth about alcohol and flying, and the deep psychology behind a fear of flying which has nothing to do with…a fear of flying.  Books referenced in this episode are”  The Easy Way To Enjoy Flying” by Allen Carr and "The Anxiety and Phobia Workbook" by Edmund J. Bourne, PHD.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: I SEEM FUN: MINI EPISODE FOR NOVEMBER 15th, 2016
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen talks about why this week’s episode #157 doesn’t talk about anything but fear of flying.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THIS WEEK SEEMED FUN Episode 3: “DIVIDED STATES OF AMERICA”
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This podcast is a weekly, Friday night bonus installment of “I Seem Fun” where Jen takes a half hour to talk about what happened in pop culture and politics this week that SHE cares about. This week Jen talks for a full hour about the “Divided States of America.”  This episode may not be for the first time listener.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: Fired Up
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen takes to the All Things Comedy studio for a live streaming episode where she talks about how she's not going to talk about the election while she talks about not forgetting all of the key players in the suffragette movement, talking to a cat on a plane, yelling at Twitter, and she changes her Gmail password on air.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THIS WEEK SEEMED FUN Episode 2
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This podcast is a weekly, Friday night bonus installment of “I Seem Fun” where Jen takes a half hour to talk about what happened in pop culture and politics this week that SHE cares about. This week Jen talks about the discovery that Amelia Earhart was a cast-a-way, Michael’s Moore’s Tweet Fail, The Cubs, an asteroid just missed Earth, and the premiere of Hallmark’s newest Christmas movie.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: CLASSY-FIED LISTENER EMAILS
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to read listener emails - we discuss favorite smells, worst smells, why does Elton John sing about having a wife, voting from Malta, finding bacteria, The Kennedy’s killed Marilyn? and Jen reads an article about politics at the end.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THIS WEEK SEEMED FUN Episode 1
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: In a new installment of “I Seem Fun” - Jen is adding a weekly half hour show to talk about what happened in pop culture and politics that she cares about - this week. In the premiere episode Jen talks about Joe Biden’s mom telling him to bloody people’s lip, the bizarre family dynamics of the bachelor in Logo’s Finding Prince Charming, Jill Stein’s investments and Jen’s own ideals versus reality, and RIP Vine.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ALIENS ARE NOT FUN
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in the All Things Comedy Studio for the first ever LIVE STREAMING VIDEO of “I Seem Fun!” But don’t worry you can still listen to this episode in all of your usual places.  She talks about how aliens are trying to make contact according to many mainstream news sites, her bout with depression last week that left her feeling like she didn’t even want to live in Paris and read for a living, putting up Christmas decorations on November 1st, uninspiring gym instructors who can’t stop yelling cliches about the weekend and reveals the exciting details of her lonely Christmas card for 2016. At the end of the episode after the 61 minute mark - two political articles are read.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: SHAME SHAME GO AWAY COME AGAIN SOME OTHER DAY
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits on stage LIVE from the Hollywood Improv Lab to talk to the audience about Corey, Courtney, being shamed on Instagram by her followers for her personal tastes, college kids who need counseling over costumes, Daylight Savings Time, a Golden Girls episode about assisted suicide, listener emails - including a new one from the I Seem Fun Official Airline Mechanic. The end of the episode (not in the live show) Jen reads two articles in her continuing election season special bonus minutes

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: IS ANYBODY OUT THERE?
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
Jen sits at home to wonder if anyone even listens to the podcast anymore as she discusses the dumb remarks made by a male TV exec last week, deals with a visit from the F The Haters girl, reads listener emails from one possibly rude person, someone who cried at Sully, and someone who is trying to find friends on Craigslist.
At minute 47 the regular podcast ends and Jen reads two articles that she hopes her Third Party Voters will listen to:
“The Lousy Reason I Didn’t Vote in 1968 - And Why Sanders Supporters Shouldn’t Fall For it” by Michael Ansara on Vox.com
“An Eight Point Brief For LEV (Lesser Evil Voting)” by John Halle & Noam Chomsky on JohnHalle.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: FEAR OF AMENITY KITS
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk about the conspiracy theories behind her podcast, the myth of Hollywood liberals, a man who was afraid of a woman’s amenity kit on a flight, the details of her comedy special taping in NYC, taking steroids and loving it, and a warning to a dermatologist who contacted her on Instagram for Botox.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THEY SEEM FUN - EPISODE 1
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This episode of I Seem Fun is very special because Jen sits in the All Things Comedy Studio - not alone but with a guest for a conversion. “They Seem Fun” is going to be a new sometimes addition to the I Seem Fun podcast - bonus episodes if you will and I know you will. But this week since we needed the content - I’m putting it up as a regular episode. Please welcome my guest Dan Bucatinsky as we discuss, what is real success, the worst ways to die, growing up in the real world, wanting to stay in reality, going to therapy, and so much more. Please excuse that I say “yeah” a lot when I listen. TERRIBLE habit. Won’t happen again.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: LIVE FROM PORTLAND, OR
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits on stage at the Helium Comedy Club in Portland, OR for her first live I Seem Fun taping at a proper comedy club!  She tells the epic tale of being kicked out of a restaurant for wanting to order off of the room service menu, the shaming of a restaurant manager, two apology notes and her new Tier 4 hotel status.  She also reads a listener email from a guy who was being stalked, and the mystery of why dudes used to wear powdered wigs and then why they stopped is solved.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF Cancel Announcement 9-21
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: jenkirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: COMEDIANS IN PLANES ON 9/11 AND COFFEE
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in the All Things Comedy Studio to tell you about a strange day at a coffee shop getting both recognized and pitied but the same person, a secret note of appreciation she got while in a coffee shop, a father and son duo getting kicked off of her plane on 9/11 (this year), and the joy of Andy Warhol’s diary.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: I Seem Fun Social Media Takeover! Listen before 9-15!
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: jenkirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: Youth is Wasted on the Young
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen recaps the weekend of shows in Scottsdale, talks about upcoming things, and talks about her soul realization and tears before anesthesia. But mostly the episode is one long cathartic rant telling young people to go live life and stop shaming older people with their stupid article links about things we know about already online and it's ruining the fun of the Internet.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: Rocket Woman On A Train
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in the All Things Comedy studio to worry about waking up during her upcoming endoscopy, to tell the story of an annoying bread store employee, a woman on the train who was annoying and then made Jen cry to herself, and a tale of bugs on a NYC subway.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: Live at the Hollywood Improv Lab
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits on stage at the new monthly I Seem Live show to talk about the plusses and minuses of a plus one at a wedding, a run-in with the cops in London, some listener emails are read and the audience comes together to give advice to a listener about where to meet men. And of course 9/11 is mentioned three times.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF Announcement August 17
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: jenkirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF Announcement August 10
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: jenkirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: "MADAME, NOT A PROVOCATION BUT…”
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home on her couch to tell you a touching story out of NY about a man without a voice but lots of goodwill, a story of red flags, a list of qualities a man must have and being so wrong about that list, things that she can’t put in the description, and traveling to Venice alone and the worst ghost tour ever.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: MUM’S THE WORD
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen is in Venice, Italy but has recorded a listener email episode in advance - where she sits at home to answer questions - one juicy question is about what do to about your roommate’s homophobic mom who lives with you two days a week. Jen also talks about why some weddings are really fun.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: I SLEEP FUN
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen is in London but has recorded a listener email episode in advance - where she sits at home to answer questions - that seem to have a theme about comfort.  The questions and emails are about taking care of birds, spirit animals, stuffed animals, bickering boyfriends, hugs from Spandex, and is it bad to listen to podcasts?

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: WHEN IS IT NICE AND WHEN IS IT RUDE?
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen talks about stupid people who suck at having past lives and then tries to get through reading an article on millennial males but is interrupted by checking her emails and then losing her mind over a friend insisting that Jen relax from working too much by going on vacation with a married couple and their children.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: A BUMP IN THE NIGHT
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about an old story she has from her comedy days in NYC getting bumped at a club by a famous comic - and not realizing at the time how cool that is and re-tells the story from a different place and points out where she had it all wrong as a twenty-something. She also reads an article about the new all-female Hells’ Angels - keeping pervs off of the NYC subway.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ALL I NEED IS HOT WATER!
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to issue some frustrations in complaint corner about how people get way too confused when someone orders hot water, a guy who made a stupid joke at Starbucks and everyone laughed, why bother working hard in comedy when people like stupid humor, an ISF assignment - send in your photo!, the story behind the breakup, and a special group hug for all of the depressed I Seem Fun friends out there.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: “BY THE TIME I GET…”
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about playing a plastic organ as a kid, by herself, and singing along to depressing Glenn Campbell songs, a crazy mom of five who is stalking Jen’s social media and writing terrible things, the worst interview ever, and how do alligators get into man-made lagoons. I Seem Fun is a proud member of the All Things Comedy Network!

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: CANTALOUPE
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in the official All Things Comedy studio to record a listener email episode where listeners want to talk about the politics of skipping a wedding reception, when your sister is dating a DUI-having loser, the power of a pink mini-skirt that helped end a relationship and find a new apartment, a married mom enjoyed getting hit on late night at a 7-11, and a massage therapist says everyone should STFU. I Seem Fun is a proud member of the All Things Comedy Network!

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: I BET I HATE THAT BAND….A LISTENER EMAIL EPISODE
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in the official All Things Comedy studio to record a listener email episode. Whether listeners asked or not Jen discusses if or why Wi-Fi passwords are private, why she can’t make a list of songs, how millennial think she has good taste in music, how she doesn’t know enough new music, the joy of driving across America, why sharks are cool, and what to do about an ex who has a kid and lives in your neighborhood.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: “That’s Called Camouflage"
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about her coffee comment overreaction on Facebook, how annoyed she is at a snake and a mansplain in the woods, her tour schedule, why are all dental hygienists retro 1908’s alcoholics, more news on ADHD, why she doesn’t care if Alkaline water is bs, and jokes about being a corporate whore.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: WHERE SHOULD WE DANCE?
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about people who thinking having dinner with friends is therapy, how she’s proud she used to drink her coffee like an American, a new episode of Dr. Barbara Persons, a reading from the NY Times Sunday Styles Vows Section and what if there was an I Seem Fun dance party? This episode is sponsored by Talkspace.com and I Seem Fun is a proud member of the All Things Comedy Network, go to Allthingscomedy.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THE MOST OFFENSIVE EPISODE EVER AND ALSO BORING
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to discuss ADHD, manic furniture purchases, how low beds are depressing, every political party is the Tea Party now, yelling at college kids who don’t know that broke isn’t poor, and a cashier with a stump arm who said a compliment went to her head.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: GO GET SOME CANDLES
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to tell you about her love of babies but suspicions of toddlers, why you should go get yourself some candles, the Live Laff Love woman had a Twitter scandal on Mother’s Day, an update on the Prince dream, and we learn a few things about women at the White House Correspondents Dinner and some words that you’re using correctly.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: WHAT’S A PODCAST?
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in the tub to talk to you about how the tour went, the proper way to multitask while bathing, being too depressed to get out of bed after a life-altering dream, and yeah more about Prince.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF MINI EPISODE CALIFORNIA DREAMIN
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to her Los Angeles and San Francisco ISeem Funners about what’s up for this week.  Timesensitive!

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: WAAAH YOUR LIFE IS HARD
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen is back! So is her raspy voice but we’ll get through. Jen paces her apartment with a microphone to talk to you about a mom on Twitter who thinks Jen’s life is easy, how the tour has been going and how it’s not fair that Prince and Bowie are gone.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: MINI EPISODE
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: NO FEELING: Jen thanks everyone for the great first week of the tour and complains about people who still don’t know what the hell vocal nodules are

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: MINI EPISODE - OUT TO PASTURE
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: In this mini episode Jen explains why it’s a mini episode and really, really, gets real with why you need to listen to this immediately.  She doesn’t want to eat grass in a pasture.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF update
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: http://jenkirkman.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: EATING BON BONS AT WORK
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Except for the three minute intro from Melbourne (Ma, ma, my arm is numb) - Jen recorded this episode mostly in advance to answer emails about how to be a broke vegetarian, how to deal with a toxic work environment involving married bosses, and listeners write in to tell inspirational balding and yes, 9/11 stories.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: NICE BOD, BAD COUCH
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen has recorded this episode partly from Sydney (where she discusses their views of Trump and her odd experience in her NZ hotel being held “hostage” by Greenpeace) and then the other part recorded in advance she talks to talk to you about Madonna and her clowning around, the episode also contains some scintillating advice to listener emails about the importance of apartment aesthetics seen in the background of a d-pick, how to get over an ex without hanging going to yoga class with him, and what to do when your white friend on Facebook calls you a racist piece of S?

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: I DON’T WANT A TRAVEL GUIDE
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen walks around her apartment to talk to you about her new pause button, finding it weird when people suggest she hang out with strangers on a solo exploring trip, and why bicycles were revolutionary for women despite people warning that they would get too horny by riding them.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: PAUSE AND EFFECT
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: In what is the weirdest episode of I Seem Fun - Jen starts off in not the greatest of moods and then unknowingly hits pause three minutes in - 40 minutes later after the episode was “recorded” in her mind - she looked down to see, nope. So she decided to commit and power through with what time she had left - only 20 minutes and took the episode in a different direction, got happy and read some listener emails.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ANNOUNCE THE ISF #IKNOWJK MOVEMENT
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: EVERYONE HERE IS A GOOD PERSON
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen wanders her apartment to talk to you about the Oscars, it’s okay to ask a woman who she is wearing, recording her audio book, an episode of Dr. Barbara Persons, trouble at Starbucks and candle shops.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THE GRATEFUL 8 - BONUS WEEK #8
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This is the last episode in the 8-week series of special Listener Email episodes only in January and February 2016 - known as “The Grateful 8.“  In this episode Jen reads emails from listeners who have questions about; dumping a toxic friend, what to wear around the house, should you try again after a bad one night stand, revisiting music from the nineties, and of course, 9/11!

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: VOTES AND VOWS
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
Jen sits at home to get annoyed at young people who don’t plan to vote in the general election, she talks her upcoming tour, and per readers request analyzes more New York Times Sunday Styles marriages in the vows section.
This episode brought to you by Squarespace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THE GRATEFUL 8 - BONUS WEEK #7
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This is the seventh episode in the 8-week series of special Listener Email episodes only in January and February 2016 - known as “The Grateful 8.“  In this episode Jen reads emails from listeners who have questions about; are her books relatable to men?, what about people who own one outfit, should not-hot people not ask out hot people, and some thoughts on how to wear a black bra under a white shirt.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: MAKE LIKE A TREE AND LEAVE
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about dismissive doctors, keeping break-ups from her family, announcing her Melbourne comedy dates, what the hell is president’s day, sleeping under a tree on a mat, and children who don’t know where to crap.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THE GRATEFUL 8 - BONUS WEEK #6
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This is the sixth episode in the 8-week series of special Listener Email episodes only in January and February 2016 - known as “The Grateful 8.“  In this episode Jen reads emails from listeners who have questions about; what notable people would be I Seem Funners, how to handle getting back together with a boyfriend who drops a HUGE secret, how not to get hives, and what to do when you’re young and want to give up on your dreams.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: REVOLUTION FROM A FLOOR PILLOW
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about the rage she felt at someone suggesting that she “wash her hands,” is her book cover offensive to women, men, and people who don’t like to see shoulders, hypochondria, vomiting in sinks, and revisits an interview she published with Gloria Steinem back in 2000.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: The Grateful Eight - Bonus Week Five
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This is the fifth episode in the 8-week series of special listener email episodes only in January and February 2016 - known as “The Grateful Eight”.  In this episode Jen reads emails from listeners who have questions about how to have better skin, how to deal with rich, business man customers who tell you to “smile”, as well as questions from a listener about the making of Jen’s Netflix special and one woman writes in to declare that she is NOT getting new boobs.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: FOOLED TWICE BY A GOAT
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about the breakup of the Tiger and the Goat, how a goat butted her up in the air when she was a kid, being "Kancelled on for Kocktails”, and getting in trouble with the public for getting glam.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: The Grateful Eight - Bonus Week Four
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This is the fourth episode in the 8-week series of special listener email episodes only in January and February 2016 - known as “The Grateful Eight”.  In this episode Jen reads emails from: a listener who have questions about how to feel better about depression, a woman whose family prays for her to get a husband but she likes traveling the world alone, someone who wants to know what she thinks of “gender reveal” parties, and a listener who confesses a juicy yet embarrassing office crush situation.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: COFFEE NIGHTMARES
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about two annoying things up front that nobody ever likes hearing about, Leo D’s penchant for women and cheese, why she’s jealous of a blizzard, internet know-it-all’s, and how she wants to yell Gordon Ramsey style at a Starbucks. This episode is brought to you by Rabble.tv

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: The Grateful Eight - Bonus Week Three
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
The Grateful Eight - Bonus Week Three
This is the third episode in the 8-week series of special listener email episodes only in January and February 2016 - known as “The Grateful Eight”.  In this episode Jen reads emails from listeners who have questions about things to do in Europe, if she’s seen Star Wars, moving out of your parent’s home for the first time, how to get over childhood fears like diving, and Jen finds out what a Thunder Blanket is used for - and wants one.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: I’M SO TIRED AND I DON’T DO CROSSWORDS
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary:
Jen sits in bed to talk to you about why she’s not up for eulogizing David Bowie, her recent bout of tired, she throws her support behind adult coloring books, admonishes crossword puzzles, has a nervous breakdown about a guy who didn’t know how to stand in line (and his defenders), and schools millennials who write emails to get a job. 
This episode is sponsored by Squarespace.com

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: The Grateful Eight - Bonus Week Two
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This is the second episode in the 8-week series of special listener email episodes only in January and February 2016 - known as “The Grateful Eight”.  In this episode Jen reads emails from listeners who have questions about if comedians are lonely, how to not talk to someone anymore, and how to make kid’s pretend flight authentic.  Listener emails also include stories of a no-talking meditation retreat, and a listener passed on that her doctor friend is worried about Jen’s high risk for cancer.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: I DON’T BELIEVE MY BELIEFS
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in bed to talk to you about her psychic dreams, an upcoming visit with a medium, the embarrassment of calling herself a “humorist” when she was younger,  people who stress out about answering texts, people not using headphones with iPads, the joys of renting, fire alarms, roof leaks, and a story of unlikely best friends.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: The Grateful Eight - Bonus Week One
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: This is the first episode in the 8-week series of special listener email episodes only in January and February 2016 - known as “The Grateful Eight”.  In this episode Jen reads emails from listeners who have questions about crazy hair colors, favorite drink recipes, how to suck it up on holidays when you don’t have kids.  The I Seem Fun pilot checks in and Jen explains to listeners why she doesn’t want to know if you would marry her.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: Space Junk
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about her favorite things but unlike Oprah can’t give any to you, then she drops that and discusses how to travel right from TSA pre-check to white noise machines, and then talks about the Malaysian Airline flying the wrong way, comets may or may not destroy earth soon or never, and how we created a lot of junk in space.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: I Seem Sick
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about her cold, the madness that is Elf on a Shelf, campaign donations, a certain news-channel is ruining people’s Christmas, and couples on planes acting like it’s Paris on a spring day.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: BROKEN CORKS AND EAVESDROPPING
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home on the couch to record an episode after one got deleted.  She talks about overhearing dudes bonding, not knowing how to use a wine cork, a guy who usually flies first class, why Christmas should be a good time for the depressed, and why is Christmas turning into Valentine’s Day?

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF ANNOUNCEMENT
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: ISF ANNOUNCEMENT for 12/04/15

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: THE HALF-ASSED THANKSGIVING EPISODE
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in bed to talk to you about creativity, how to get started in anything, how nothing is ever finished, figuring out why people laugh, and we re-visit the very first episode of I Seem Fun in the spirit of looking back on just starting something and letting it take on a life of it’s own. Happy Thanksgiving, Just Keep Livin’.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: LISTENER EMAIL CATCH UP
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in bed, to talk to you about how she’s neglected her listener emails to the I Seem Fun Gmail Account. Topics covered from listeners are outrage culture, harassment, organizing in autumn, a new sociologist I Seem Fun helper, a guy who isn’t a stalker but seems like one, and where have the pilots been?

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: WHAT A BUMMER TO HAND SOMEONE A CANDY CANE
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits in bed to talk to you about her nodule progress, Hallmark Christmas movies, putting her tree up on Friday the 13th, Thanksgiving week, heading to London, and annoying elevator conversations about how much stuff she’s holding.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: WET KALE AND ANGELS
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home, in bed, to talk to you about how she hates when people ask about weekends, boring exorcisms, being the only one to show up for class, stomach aches, rotten wet kale, angels, devils, sex in Hell, Halloween, and how witch means gynecologist.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: BIG FUN
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home - (she’s back!) - to talk to you about a forgotten disco hit, an update on vocal therapy, her parents at a Ringo Starr concert, getting in trouble for a tattoo, her voting record, and a recent Hollywood bullshit experience.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: HOME DEEP OHHHHMM
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home, on a thirty-minute I Seem Fun episode, to talk to you about how the episodes will be shorter during the vocal repair journey, Home Depot employees, it’s either nothing or cancer, bistro lights, handymen, and organizing. This episode brought to you by Casper Mattress

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: Hoe, Oh, Let's Go
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits live on stage from the LA Podfest in Beverly Hills to talk to the audience about her vocal nodules, a mass email to friends, Hugh Hefner's control issues, dissing an old classmate, and reads a listener email about the myth of the vacation.

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: ISF ANNOUNCEMENT
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: ISF ANNOUNCEMENT for 09/15/15

episodes.seriesTitle: I Seem Fun: The Diary of Jen Kirkman Podcast
episodes.title: The World Is Changing
episodes.author: Jen Kirkman
episodes.summary: Jen sits at home to talk to you about a hotel fail in San Diego, the Burrito Man hates war, making room for RUSH (the band), and comedian David Quirk joins for a discussion about dropping offensive jokes and being called out. There is a trigger warning in this episode for the second half.
